fields.description:
My use case was formatting an index value of {{1}} on a pull request. Further testing shows other examples such as {{a}} and {{?}} don't.

However, values such as {{a1}}, {{1a}}, {{?a}} work as expected. This leads me to believe it's a problem with single character values.

Current workaround is inserting a code block through the editor menu and typing in my desired value.
fields.summary: backtick doesn't autoformat code block for single character in pull request comment

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce issue:

# Create a new pull request
# Enter a single-quote character as the first character of the Description field
# Click "Create Pull Request"

Actual Results: First character of the Description field is now a backslash character. The single-quote follows the backslash immediately.

Expected Results: First character of the Description field should still be a single-quote.
fields.summary: Backslash character prepended to Pull Request Description field

fields.description:
I really like the new Trello Board integration into the repositories.

I our case our projects are divided into several small services (I don't want to say microservices) which the marketing team doesn't care at all.

But projects are grouped into bigger entities understandable by everyone. Thus I think it would be nice to have the Trello Board feature at the Project level.

fields.description: It will be a good user experience if you add a  title over user image for quick view
fields.summary: Title not appearing over user image on left side bar

fields.description:
For example, if the textarea has a default height of, say, 10 lines, if my text has more than 10 lines a vertical scrollbar will appear. In that case, in order to be able to view my whole message, I need to manually resize the textarea and scroll the page to fit it into view.

What I am suggesting is for the text area to automatically recalculate its height, and fit it into view, if possible, according to height of the the lines of the text I am writing.

Sort of like how GitHub does it.
fields.summary: Make editor's textarea auto resize when height of text exceeds height of textarea

fields.description:
Since Wednesday 13 Sep 2017 we're having intermittent issues to clone, pull and push due to ssh authentication issues. The Bitbucket status page doesn't mention any issues on your side, but I'm pretty sure it is.

We get the following error a lot but not every time:

{code}
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}
fields.summary: Intermittent ssh authentication issues

fields.description: I not update webhooks but webhooks change to inactive.

fields.description:
When a Pull Request is created there will be a list of commit messages. Upon clicking merge, a pop up is shown with a field "Commit Message".

This field does not load all of the commit messages to be merged. It just shows the commit message along with the PR title.  Upon changing the merge strategy to "Squash", the commit message field loads all of the commit messages. Changing the merge strategy back to merge commit, removes the commit messages from the "commit message field."

However, when merge is clicked and a line is removed from the commit message field, changing the merge strategy to squash/merge does not load anything in the commit message field.\\
!1669566880-1.PNG|thumbnail!

!371759347-2.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Merge Pull Request Commit message, does not display the full commit message.
Upgrade Bitbucket to Atlassian Connect v5

fields.description: Integrate pipelines with Zapier
fields.summary: Zapier

fields.description: Currently in each file you have line numbers for easy reference, but if you have multiple files you when some refers to a line they need to tell you the file and the line then you have to go hunting for it. If you had another set of numbers it would be easy to say go to PR line 1445 and everyone could quickly get there. This would help live reviews greatly.
fields.summary: Have continuous line numbers in PRs for live reviews

fields.description:
Hi,\\
Two members of our development team have, at the same time or very close it, merged two different pull requests.

The result is strange. Both merged pull requests show that they have been merged at the same commit. Looking at the commits shows a different result.

These are the Pull Requests:

!4247025794-PR3979.JPG|thumbnail!\\
!713825871-PR3989.JPG|thumbnail!

There are the merge commits:

!2892782781-Commit_Clare.JPG|thumbnail!\\
!1081989568-Commit_Ian.JPG|thumbnail!

This has happened previously, and it only appears to happen when the pull requests are merged at the same time or close to it.

Marin
fields.summary: Pull Request merge bug?

fields.description:
In BitBucket source view it is inconvenient for large projects to navigate folder by folder by clicking on each of them individually. It would streamline ux if there was a textfield extension next to current directory field with suggestions and autocompletions, after final click it would navigate to textfield-accumulated directory.

For more clarity please see attached image.\\
!1390692316-bitbucket-suggestion.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Hello,

currently the "Require issue keys in commit messages" adds a default check on regexp for jira issues from the link:\\
(((?P<linker_value>([\w-]\+))-\d+))\\
This regex is not changeable. Adding new link with other regex is ignored.

It would be great if the regex check on valid Jira issues is configurable for each repository. e.g.:\\
repository 1 \-> valid allowed  issue key: ABC-\d+\\
repository 2 \-> valid  allowed issue key: XYZ-\d+

All other jira issue matching default regex should not be allowed.

rgds
fields.summary: Require issue keys in commit messages: restrict on regexp per repository
Restore pull request count in new UI

fields.description:
Currently, users who have direct access to repository will not be able to see the Build Minutes Usage. The "Usage" button in the pipelines tab does not give information. Users will also see the message "Your usage will reset on Invalid Date".

The cause of this is because the user does not have access to the account that owns this repository.

In this same Usage pop up, users with admin access to repository are seeing "0 / -1 free minutes used this period." which is incorrect.

If would be nice if there could be a pop up that shows that the current user does not have the required permission to retrieve the usage information.

!1312637555-1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Users with admin access only to repository see incorrect message on Pipelines Usage

fields.description:
Many times, I'd like to only fire webhooks on either failed builds or successful builds.

Currently, the only option is: "Build status updated."

However, I'd like to only ping my CI server if builds succeed, and only ping slack if builds fail.

I'd like to propose adding a checkbox for each build status in the webhooks, to allow this more granular control.
fields.summary: More Granular Control for Webhooks on Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description:
Hi Team,

My colleagues working out of US office, they are not facing any issue to cloning/pushing repo code from bitbucket.\\
In US connection speed test showing below result to clone  https://bitbucket.org/mirror/git.git

Receiving objects: 100% (226345/226345), 52.94 MiB | 20.52 MiB/s, done.

======================================================================

I'm currently at India Office and I've checked my internet connection and things are fairly speedy (steady around 45mbps according to speedtest).\\
I've facing problem cloning/pushing my repo code up to bitbucket. it's very slow. if i want to clone 700MB repo code, it's taking  20 minut time.

In INDIA connection speed test showing below result to clone  https://bitbucket.org/mirror/git.git

Receiving objects: 100% (226345/226345), 52.94 MiB | 274.00 KiB/s, done.

I have checked our status page (https://status.bitbucket.org/) and result is everything green.

--- bitbucket.org ping statistics ---

11 packets transmitted, 11 received, 0% packet loss, time 10009ms\\
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 275.277/278.945/284.095/3.746 ms

Any idea to clone 1GB repo code in 2-4 minute ?

Thanks !\\
Nitin Kumar
fields.summary: Bitbucket repo Cloning slow | IN

fields.description:

However, as soon as add "pipelines" to the endpoint I get "Resource not found errors"; /api/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/pipelines/. A attempted the same endpoint as a POST request with data to run a custom build process defined in my bitbucket-pipelines.yml

Currently I have no idea how to continue to debug this.
fields.summary: Pipelines API endpoint returns "Resource not found"

fields.description:
Our team used [BFG|https://rtyley.github.io/bfg-repo-cleaner/] to rewrite the history of a large repo (1.1GB according to BB) to use LFS. This effectively rewrites all commits that contained our big files as if we had used LFS the first time around. Looking at the blob size the biggest blobs were stored in LFS.

When we used push -f to move the changes to Bitbucket, the size of the git LFS used increased from 0 to 1.5GB (sure) but the size of the history increased from 1.1GB to 1.3GB.

We ported all branches.
fields.summary: Repository size went up after rewriting history with LFS

fields.description:

# Create a pull request from branchA to branchB
# Create another pull request from branchA to branchB with a different description

From the observation, we can see that Bitbucket does not create a duplicate pull request but rather updates the description with the later update.

Bitbucket should throw an error instead of overwriting existing information
fields.summary: When a duplicate pull request is created, the pull request content (description) is replaced with the later pull request

Hi.\\
I have created an account in the "link in with google" way and the normal account way.\\

It immediately said something along the lines of "You have two accounts with this email, do you want to merge the account?". Me thinking that "merge" will actually *merge* the accounts clicked "yes". after a few seconds I saw that i did'nt have any repos, (that is actually not a problem, to the only important repo I have a backup in another computer) so I tried to log out log in but the only problem is that I could'ent  log in. After that I logged in with the google way and there too I did'nt see the repos, so again, I logged out and I tried to reset my password, entered my email, clicked "continue" and I did'nt receive any mail

To me it isn't that a big of a problem. I'm just warning you before it does something to a person that has no backup.

fields.description:
We restrict writes to the master branch to a specific group of senior team members, and require all writes to master to come from a pull request.  Our teams are fairly dynamic and membership changes periodically,  Presently it requires a Bitbucket Server administrator to modify the group membership creating a bit more busy work for the admin than we would like.

It would be nice to have the ability to delegate administration of a group to a user.  Specifically, when the group is created, designate a group member who is able to add/delete new members.
fields.summary: Provide new permission to manage group membership

For a non-administrator user this link is presented but when clicked reports 0 minutes along with a cryptic message about the billing period not being reset or something.

We would like for all our users to have access to the build minutes consumption so we regard this as a bug.

Thanks!\\
Giorgos

fields.description:
if a webhook URL contains a username and password for use with HTTP basic auth and the username is URL-encoded, the username will not be properly decoded before being sent to the external server.\\
Example: If you have a URL like "http://user%40example.com:password@example.com/foo", the username "user@example.com" should be sent (and  the "%40" converted to "@").
fields.summary: URL-encoded username in HTTP basic auth doesn't work with webhooks (BBCDEV-7882)

fields.description:
Users with some Visual impairment, need options as High Contrast at BitBucket Cloud interface.

A high contrast option in the new ADG3 would help these users to use the BitBucket Cloud webUI.
fields.summary: High contrast option for new navigation

fields.description:
When there is a big review a developer may go to the review and do a part of it, then leave and come back later.  Yet it may have click on some file/diff without having fully review them.

When he returned bitbucket may not display those files as bold anymore since the user did click on them once.

I need a flag such as "Accepted" on each file/diff so that the developer can say "I did this file or diff" which would be a better way to track where he is at in its review than if the file / diff has or not been seen by the reviewer in question which is not trustable.
fields.summary: Need a flag such as "Accepted" for each file/diff in the review tool

This way, users will only need to manage one SSH Key instead of multiple.

fields.description:
Just had a build that normally takes ~20 minutes run for an hour and a half, before I manually stopped it. I see in the docs it'd eventually time out at two hours, but really once this build hits ~40 minutes we can be confident something's wrong.

It'd be good to be able to configure an upper limit per repo, to time out, send alerts or both.
fields.summary: Maximum time limit / timeout for Pipelines builds

fields.description: I was using Bitbucket API to fetch commit messages for some analysis. I couldn't just fetch commit messages which are not merged messages. Is it possible to get a flag to differentiate a way to query and fetch just merge commit ids?

image/vnd.fastbidsheet) -- This may be an update for pygit

fields.description: It appears that the repo description (Settings -> Repository details -> Description) isn't shown anywhere any longer. It should be shown at least on the summary page, or even at the top of the commits and code overview pages.
fields.summary: Display repo description in summary

fields.description: I have branches on a git repository that I would like to lock down to only allow pull requests after at least one approval. The branches are based on our versioning scheme (specifically the branch names are 11.4, 11.5, 11.6, and 11.7). In order to not have to add new rules for every version I set the branch permissions pattern to 11.? to match both cases (recognizing that higher than 11.9 will not work since ? only matches a single character). I apply the permissions as shown in the screenshot, but my user (an admin to the repository) is still able to create a pull request and merge it without any approvals as shown. Using 11.* works perfectly fine, but catches additional branches we don't want it to lock down. It seems that the ? wildcard character doesn't work as the documentation describes for branch permissions. https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/branch-permission-patterns-776639814.html
fields.summary: Branch permissions with ? wildcard don't work properly

fields.description:
When going to the *Branches* menu, it takes 3 clicks to actually remove a branch, as compared to Github. While it might not seem like a lot, this can add-up if someone is deleting many stale remote branches in a repository. Comparison videos seen below:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cqkojlsf1lzdvsa/bitbucket-delete-branch.mov?dl=0 (20 seconds in Bitbucket)

https://www.dropbox.com/s/xla6d2ni66p018g/github-delete-branches.mov?dl=0 (7 seconds in Github)

Secondly, changing the "Close branch" dialogue into something easier to understand (such as "Delete branch") would help confusion when merging in a branch.
fields.summary: Improvement on branch management in UI

fields.description:
h3. Configuration:
I am running an instance of Bitbucket v5.3.1 in a Docker container using the image published to the atlassian Docker Hub account:

https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/bitbucket-server/

This is run behind a [Caddy|https://caddyserver.com/] reverse proxy that handles HTTPS encryption.

h3. Issue:
When trying to search, I get the error message: "Search is currently unavailable". Looking at my server settings in the administration panel, the Test button under the Search section would say that there was an authentication problem.

h3. Resolution:
I ran Bitbucket's log analyzer which noticed the problem with search and referred me to this troubleshooting page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/troubleshooting-steps-for-bitbucket-server-code-search-827125334.html

Following the troubleshooting page, I first verified that Elasticsearch was starting and that my username and password were correct. Diving deeper, one of the steps is to check that you can connect to port 7992 locally, and to verify the Elasticsearch configuration is valid. The sample configuration was:

{code}
[root@mybbs search]# cat elasticsearch.yml
cluster.name: bitbucket_search
node:
  name: bitbucket_bundled
  local: true

network.host: _localhost_

discovery.zen.ping.multicast.enabled: false

action.auto_create_index: false
index.mapper.dynamic: false
http.port: 7992
{code}

My configuration matched the example except for an extra line at the end:

{code}
transport.tcp.port: 7993
{code}

I could not find anywhere in the setup documentation that mentioned openning port 7993. After mapping this port to the host machine and restarting the container running Bitbucket, search worked again and no longer shows up as an issue in the log analyzer.
fields.summary: Cannot reach Elasticsearch when running Bitbucket in a Docker container

fields.description:
We have dozens of repos, all using bitbucket pipelines. We have standardized stuff as much as possible, i.e. created scripts in our own docker image.

Now when something is changed, like the recent addition of a pipeline for {{hotfix}} branches, we need to touch each branch in each repository to update the {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}}.

It would be great if we could centralize this somehow, e.g. configure a global default configuration, or alternatively use a setting in the {{yml}} like {{include: https://some.where/default/bitbucket-pipelines.yml}}.

For reference, I have attached our {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}}. You'll notice it does not include any repo-specific stuff, and we intend to keep it like this.
fields.summary: Share pipelines.yml across repos

fields.description: abcd
fields.summary: something is wrong

fields.description:
When trying to update Credit Card details in Bitbucket Cloud, the State field will show "Invalid State" when the country is Set to India as shown in the image below. Due to this, it's not possible to update credit card details with the correct billing information.

!2440499650-1.PNG|thumbnail!

As a workaround, you can specify the abbreviation for the State name. As for the State shown in the image above, you can enter "OR" and there will be no error shown.

!4014212355-2.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Credit Card page shows Invalid State when country is set to India

fields.description: My email en atlassian not is equal to bitbucket account. I have same email for both account please.
fields.summary: bitbucket account

fields.description:
I have a custom Oracle Database docker image that I need to use for my builds, but in order for the container to start properly, I need to set the following flags on the docker run command:

{code}
#!bash

--shm-size 1g
--ulimit nofile=1024:65536
--ulimit nproc=16384
--ulimit stack=10485760:33554432
--ulimit memlock=137438953472


{code}

I can get away with just setting --shm-size, but being able to set the ulimit params would allow me to commit and use the image rather than needing a separate process to setup the production image.

I've tried setting up my container as a service in my pipeline, but it appears not to be running when my build gets to the part where it relies on the database. As a side request, you should also provide deeper logging for the docker environment used by builds so we can see what is actually happening. I can only guess (with 99.9% certainty based on experience outside Bitbucket Pipelines) what is happening without it.
fields.summary: Pipelines Docker SHM and ulimit params

fields.description:
OSX terminal showing the diff\\
!2331346480-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-04%20at%202.07.17%20PM.png|thumbnail!

Bitbucket showing the diff\\
!2805133688-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-04%20at%202.08.36%20PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Provide user the ability to specify specific Services' memory usage instead of using the default 1GB memory.

For example, allow users to reserve 600mb memory to a service which requires only 550 MB to run.\\
:information_source: This will allow users to utilize the remaining 400 MB for the main build process.
fields.summary: Ability to specify a specific memory usage for Pipelines Services

fields.description:
Provide the ability to add a global webhook which will apply on all the repositories under a single account instead of adding it to each repository manually.

Current Workaround with Bitbucket API:

# Use /2.0/repositories/{username} to get a list of all repositories. [Bitbucket API Repositories Resource|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D]
# Use /2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/hooks to add the webhook. [Bitbucket API Webhook Resource|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/hooks#post]
fields.summary: Ability to add Global webhook which applies to all the repositories

fields.description:
Hi\\
My company was using Cloud for a longer time and now we're migrating few repos to Server. Comments in pull request are valuable to our devs.

Is there any way to mirror pull requests?

Instructions from https://www.atlassian.com/git/articles/pull-request-proficiency-fetching-abilities-unlocked doesn't seem to work.

Any chance the Cloud team could send us {{pull-requests}} folder from the Cloud location so we could copy to our Server instance?

Many thanks

Marcin
fields.summary: Mirror pull requests from Cloud to Server

fields.description: As a browser or reviewer, I would like the ability to search across repositories for source files by filename.
fields.summary: Add search by filename

fields.description: As a reviewer or code browser, I would like to be able to navigate to other sources via hyperlink or popup button from a type name in a source file.
fields.summary: Navigation links in source files

fields.description: As a reviewer, I would like the ability to see the full source file with one click in the code review (diff) view.
fields.summary: Add ability to view full context in diff view

fields.description:
Administrators want to receive notification when they start using a new addition of 1000 minutes for paid plan in Pipelines, or start adding storage of 100 GB in Git LFS.

That is, Bitbucket should send alert to administrators when extra charge is added.
fields.summary: Notify admins that additional build minutes have been purchased and added to the plan.

fields.description:
Offering a  _Run Now_ button on a scheduled pipeline would allow us to test a newly scheduled pipeline and provide a convenient way to invoke a custom script on demand.

*Acceptance Criteria*

# View a scheduled Pipeline
# System offers a _Run Now_ button
# User presses _Run Now_ button
# System runs scheduled pipeline immediately
# System logs that scheduled pipeline ran _x time_ early.
fields.summary: Scheduled Pipelines Should Offer 'Run Now'

fields.description:
Hello!

I'm using Bitbucket Pipelines to build my docker image. When building the Dockerfile it produces a few artefacts within the image, which I would like to extract and work with in the next step of the pipeline. So how I thought I would do it would be to do a "docker create" and then "docker cp", however, the create command is not supported in pipelines.

Would adding support for the "docker create" command be something that you could consider?

Thanks\\
Sebastian
fields.summary: Support "docker create" in Pipelines

fields.description:
I am the admin and the download button is missing in my organisation bitbucket.

Is that related to permission issue or ?
fields.summary: Download button missing

fields.description:
Getting error while pushing data to online repository,\\
fatal: unable to access http://----------
fields.summary: Unable to push online repository

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Docker image logged as non-root, the build is unable to get the host's fingerprint which had fetch in the Pipelines Settings.\\
Tried to run "cat ~/.ssh/known_hosts" in the build and the known_host file is empty\\
Ran "cat /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/data/known_hosts" and getting "cat: /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/data/known_hosts: Permission denied" error.

Example:\\
Build image - Dockerfile:

{code}
#!python
FROM node:argon

RUN apt-get update
RUN apt-get -y dist-upgrade
RUN apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y -q sudo curl python build-essential git ca-certificates

RUN adduser --disabled-password --gecos '' myuser
RUN usermod -aG sudo myuser
RUN echo '%sudo ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL' >> /etc/sudoers

USER myuser
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Add the Host key to known_host file. "ssh-keyscan <Host Address> >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts"
# Allow your build to run as root user by removing "USER myuser" from the Dockerfile
fields.summary: Pipelines: known_host file is not updated to non-root user directory

fields.description:
I have following error frequencly.

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree fetch origin\\
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.\\
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://serkankayaduman@bitbucket.org/dtvh/blutv_iphone.git/'

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree pull --log origin master\\
remote: Too many failed authentication attempts. Please try again later.\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://serkankayaduman@bitbucket.org/dtvh/blutv_iphone.git/': The requested URL returned error: 429\\
Completed with errors, see above

My username and password is correct definitely. When it is, all of our team wait patiently and respectfully. After 15 minutes, everything is fine without changing. We lose a lot of time when doing fetch, push and pull.
fields.summary: source tree login error

Hi, good morning, devs!

I was investigating and I did not find information or documentation about it.\\
Is this common?

Regards

fields.description:
In a PR, we can comment a file when viewing the "main" diff but not the side-by-side diff.\\
It would be convenient to be able to comment in the side-by-side diff.
fields.summary: Comment in side-by-side diff
API: Re-approving a pull request via REST doesn't work: "You already approved this pull request"

fields.description:
I like the idea of enabling Automatic Merge of on release branches back to the main development branch, but in practice I find that it does not work as well as I had hoped.

The problem is that I will create a release branch off of our main development branch, and will make a few tweaks to the build configuration files, specific to the release under preparation. Some time later, I may commit a bug fix, which I also want committed back into my main development branch. I have enabled the automatic merge feature, but when I commit and merge my bug fix through a pull request, it opens a new Pull request merging the entire release branch back into my development branch. This means all the configuration changes that were made to prepare the release branch are now getting targeted into the main development branch, which could cause issues with clobbering over a release (through mvn site-deploy) if gone uncaught.

Perhaps it is an issue with the way our code is organized, but I feel like we can't be the only team hitting this type of issue?

It seems like one possibility, would be to open a new Pull Request that cherry-picks just the commits that were part of the bug fix pull request.

Likewise, sometimes you know that the commit going into a release branch cannot be merged as-is back to the development branch, so it would be great to be able to deselect specific branches from having a PR opened. For example, say you have a bug fix pull request targeting release/1.2.0, and the result of the Automatic Merge is that it will trickle down into release/1.2.1, release/1.3.0, and master:

{code}
#!text

release/1.2.0 (target of PR)
|-- release/1.2.1
|--|-- release/1.3.0
|--|--|-- master
{code}

You can see all these branches in the Pull Request Merge dialog when Automatic Merges are enabled, but there is no way to de-select release/1.3.0 and master branches from obtaining the fix. In some cases you may be dealing with a bug fix that was only applicable for a couple of releases.
fields.summary: Option to Cherry-Pick commits for Automatic Merge

fields.description:
I hope this is not just me missing something but it seems to me that we are missing the feature of attaching results to other things than purely commits (a process described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/publish-and-link-your-build-artifacts-872137736.html ).\\
When I run a scheduled pipeline I would like to associate results with THAT particular run of the pipeline. In my case I run regular tests of the production environment in a scheduled pipeline and I need something to link the artifacts to. Having them available on the specific run of the pipeline would be nice.
fields.summary: Attaching results to pipeline

fields.description:
Since today, whenever I run a pipelines build this happens:

{code}
#!none
scp build.tar.gz user@$ACC_SERVER_IP:~/
no such identity: /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/data/id_rsa: No such file or directory
Permission denied, please try again.
Permission denied, please try again.
Permission denied (publickey,password).

{code}

Pipelines are an essential part in our deployment proccess and we seem to hit this error on all our pipelines deploys.

Here is a community thread where people also encountered this issue since this morning:\\
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Could-opt-atlassian-pipelines-agent-data-id-rsa-become-invalid/qaq-p/631206#U631240
fields.summary: Pipelines - id_rsa not found since this morning (Deployment process broken)

fields.description:
Hi, I hope I'm missing something obvious here, but: I am using the free bitbucket account, with 4 users in my repo. I am the admin of the repo.

If I open an issue in the tracker and assign it to, say, user A, he can:

* create other issues
* comment on that issue
* close its own issues

...but cannot close/resolve the issue I created.

Is this the expected behavior? Can I change it? Am I doing something wrong?

Thanks.
fields.summary: User cannot close issue opened by admin

fields.description:
Git log for file disagrees with Bitbucket GUI which shows most recent merge commit for other files:

# Look at a file {{authentication.snippet.md}}, and notice there's a commit that doesn't correspond with the {{git log}} for the file in question (screenshot 2, 3)

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian-developers/docs/src/e8e0ae535fb5/content/cloud/connect/concepts/authentication.snippet.md?at=master&fileviewer=file-view-default

To confirm, I ran {{git log -- authentication.snippet.md}} (screenshot 2) to see the history of this file. This corresponds with the history listed in Bitbucket (click History).

!510559715-screenshot2.png|thumbnail!

Troubleshooting which commit is which because I'm guessing this was a recent merge commit:

# Person branched from master, changed one file, then it was merged. (screenshot 1)

This is the commit https://bitbucket.org/atlassian-developers/docs/commits/08bbb9c678dab10e543cf75bec48d37c1791ad32?at=master

To confirm, I did {{git log}} on {{master}}. (screenshot 1)

!1741114882-screenshot1.png|thumbnail!

What is confusing me is that the merge commit from the other file shouldn't be appearing in this list. This is extra confusing because the person who mentioned I needed to look at the file's history happened to be the person who did the branch off master. Either way, I think this should not list the merge commit since it is unrelated to the file.

!4278486801-2017-08-25_10-53-47.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Git log for file disagrees with Bitbucket GUI which shows most recent merge commit for other files
